sub_title: Senior Corporate Recruitment Specialist  | Senior Tech Recruiter Specialist | HR | Career Development
summary:
𝗛𝗶, 𝗜'𝗺 𝗥𝗼𝗯𝘆!
I've got over 8 years of experience in Talent Acquisition, focusing on tech and corporate roles.

I started as an HR Generalist and Recruiter in Switzerland, and now I'm a Senior Recruiter in Amsterdam. I've worked in start-ups, scale-ups, and large international corporations across Italy, Switzerland, and the Netherlands. Most recent companies: 𝘼𝙩𝙡𝙖𝙨𝙨𝙞𝙖𝙣, 𝙏𝙤𝙢𝙏𝙤𝙢, 𝙏𝙤𝙣𝙮'𝙨 𝘾𝙝𝙤𝙘𝙤𝙡𝙤𝙣𝙚𝙡𝙮, 𝘽𝙤𝙤𝙠𝙞𝙣𝙜.𝙘𝙤𝙢.

I thrive in fast-paced work environments where creativity, relationship building, sales skills, and effective time management are key. I'm used to navigating through missing processes, change management, and ambiguity. I've mainly worked in hybrid and 𝗿𝗲𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗲 𝘀𝗲𝘁𝘂𝗽𝘀, but I'm always up for F2F team drinks and events!

𝗜'𝗺 𝗮𝗻 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘁 𝗶𝗻:

✅Studying the big picture and creating + implementing strategies to improve processes, automate, and differentiate us from competitors
✅Building service-oriented, long-lasting relationships, always going the extra mile, to help people reach their goals 
✅Sharing best practices with the team and leading projects to improve collaboration/ Inclusion & diversity/ career development
✅Understanding the needs of my stakeholders and providing coaching, analyzing and sharing data and strategies
✅Developing and executing marketing/employer branding plans to attract both active and passive applicants 
✅Promoting and evangelizing the company culture, benefits, and unique value proposition 
✅Negotiating contracts in the best interest of all the parties 
✅Managing a large number of international candidates simultaneously with genuine care, hitting hiring targets, and working with a sense of urgency


𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘁𝘀 𝗺𝗲:

🔔I'm absolutely passionate about HR strategies, cultivating a positive work environment, leading managers through process changes, delving into HR analytics, streamlining onboarding, and nurturing talents. And guess what's on the horizon? My upcoming goal of becoming a Certified Professional Coach - I'll start the course in October 2023! 🔝

𝗥𝗲𝗮𝗰𝗵 𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝘁𝗼 𝗺𝗲 𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝗼𝗻 𝗟𝗶𝗻𝗸𝗲𝗱𝗜𝗻 𝗼𝗿 𝘀𝗲𝗻𝗱 𝗺𝗲 𝗮 𝗺𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗼𝗻: roberta.basili.hr@gmail.com.

⚠️ 𝘼𝙣𝙙 𝙞𝙛 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙬𝙖𝙣𝙩 𝙩𝙤 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙣 𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙚 𝙖𝙗𝙤𝙪𝙩 𝙬𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙩'𝙨 𝙡𝙞𝙠𝙚 𝙩𝙤 𝙬𝙤𝙧𝙠 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝 𝙢𝙚, 𝙫𝙞𝙨𝙞𝙩 𝙢𝙮 "𝙁𝙚𝙖𝙩𝙪𝙧𝙚𝙙 "𝙨𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣 𝙗𝙚𝙡𝙤𝙬, 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙍𝙚𝙘𝙤𝙢𝙢𝙚𝙣𝙙𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣𝙨 𝙖𝙩 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙗𝙤𝙩𝙩𝙤𝙢 𝙤𝙛 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙥𝙖𝙜𝙚!

treasury_media.title: What my candidates say about me - check the reviews here! (6 pages)
treasury_media.description: Discover here the unique value I strive to bring to the team and my unwavering commitment to customer orientation! Want to learn more? 𝗦𝗰𝗿𝗼𝗹𝗹 𝗱𝗼𝘄𝗻 𝘁𝗼 𝘁𝗵𝗲 "𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗺𝗲𝗻𝗱𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀" 𝘀𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻, 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘄𝗶𝗹𝗹 𝗳𝗶𝗻𝗱 𝗿𝗲𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄𝘀 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗰𝗼𝗹𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗴𝘂𝗲𝘀, 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗼𝗿𝘀, 𝗰𝗮𝗻𝗱𝗶𝗱𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀, 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗶𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗲𝗿𝘀 that shed light on my performance and competencies.

treasury_media.title: Creativity is the engine of all that I do :)
treasury_media.description: I had the opportunity to create eight paintings, including this one, for my former employer, Ignazio Messina & C. The size is 50x60cm, and I used oils as the medium. 𝗜'𝗺 𝗻𝗼𝘁 𝗮𝗳𝗿𝗮𝗶𝗱 𝘁𝗼 𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝗼𝘂𝘁𝘀𝗶𝗱𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗺𝘆 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗳𝗼𝗿𝘁 𝘇𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗹𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲𝘀, utilizing my skills in diverse ways. :)

profile_positions.description:
Atlassian empowers global teams with SW (Jira, Confluence). With 7,000 employees across 13 countries and 200,000+ customers, our mission is to unlock the potential of every team.

•Driving the recruitment for tech and corporate roles, fostering strong partnerships with hiring managers in the USA, India, and Europe. My time to hire ranges from 37 to 50 days.

•Leveraging Tableau, LinkedIn, SeekOut, Lever, iCIMS to monitor and analyze recruitment funnels and market data, fostering data-driven decision-making and optimizing our recruitment strategies for greater efficiency and success.

•Revamping job ads and social media posts with inclusive language, proactively addressing candidate needs. Achieved increasingly diverse talent applications and higher female hiring rates in male-dominated roles.

•Sourcing through LinkedIn and SeekOut, I achieve an impressive InMail response rate of 50%. Over half of my hires are female, with almost half of them being sourced candidates.

•Providing expert tips: best practices, templates, pro tips, operational improvement suggestions, for the "Recruiter's Guide to mastering our Craft" project, to enhance its quality and effectiveness.

•Created personalized interview invite emails with tips and candidate surveys. Feedback has inspired me to develop a stress-free interview technique. This resulted in a 5/5 satisfaction rate and improved pass-through rates. So far I achieved a 100% offer acceptance rate.

• 𝗟𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗺𝘂𝗹𝘁𝗶𝗽𝗹𝗲 𝘀𝗶𝗺𝘂𝗹𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗲𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁𝘀:
-Serving as the Career pillar lead for EMEA in the ERG “Women +”, suggesting events, sharing knowledge to support the career development of our colleagues.

-Creating a comprehensive offer guide for the NL, including templates and pro tips to streamline processes, enhance negotiation skills, and accelerate speed.

-Developing a new relocation guide, optimizing onboarding in the NL, improving the new hires' experience, and reducing HR Ops ticket volume.
profile_positions.title: Senior Recruiter (Technical & Corporate)

profile_positions.description:
Tom Tom is a renowned leader in the field of geolocation technology, catering to drivers, carmakers, enterprises, and developers. With a global workforce of over 4,000 employees spread across 30 offices worldwide and representing more than 80 nationalities, Tom Tom is a beacon of expertise and innovation in the geospatial technology industry.

•Drove the end-to-end recruitment for corporate functions including HR, Legal, Finance, Marketing, and Sales, leveraging strategic talent advisory to hiring managers, resulting in exceptional overall experience survey results of 4.7 out of 5.

•Delivered consistently a positive candidate experience, reflected in the survey results from candidates in various stages of the hiring process, including "in progress", "offer in process", and "ready for hire", with an overall experience rating of 4.8 out of 5.

•Implemented a highly personalized sourcing approach on LinkedIn, achieving an impressive InMail response rate of 46% and securing top-quality hires, exceeding significantly the expectations and objectives in terms of time to hire.
profile_positions.title: Talent Acquisition Consultant | Corporate Recruiter

profile_positions.description:
Tony's Chocolonely, a B-Corp and the leading chocolate brand in the Netherlands is committed to raising awareness about inequality in the chocolate industry, pioneering alternative approaches to chocolate production, and inspiring the industry to embrace 100% slave-free cocoa as the standard. With its headquarters in Amsterdam and a global workforce of 300 employees, Tony's Chocolonely is a rapidly growing scale-up.

•Led strategic and creative talent sourcing and recruitment efforts, targeting the HQ, Benelux, DACH region, and Nordics, while driving initiatives in employer branding, hiring manager training, and candidate experience projects to attract and secure top talent.

•Revamped and restructured the hiring processes, including job advertisement writing and objective candidate assessment methods, while strengthening partnerships with hiring managers, resulting in a more inclusive, structured, and fair recruitment process.

•Collaborated closely with Department heads to successfully source, close, and onboard 31 hires within an average time to hire of less than 30 days, filling critical corporate roles across multiple countries, including Sweden and Belgium where new offices were being opened.

•Championed the implementation of improvements in feedback sharing, candidate preparation, and relationship building, resulting in robust pipelines, outstanding survey scores, and long-lasting relationships, showcasing strong care for the candidate experience.
profile_positions.title: Recruiter | Talent Acquisition Partner | Benelux, DACH & The Nordics

profile_positions.description:
Booking.com is determined to make the world of travel more sustainable, more accessible, and more inclusive, to create a positive impact on a global scale. 17.000 employees worldwide, 140 offices, 70 countries, 150 nationalities.

I began my tenure as a Customer Service Recruiter and later transitioned to join the Finance recruitment team.

•Exceeded hiring targets (160% achievement) across 12 languages through strategic reporting and data-driven insights to optimize search strategies based on top-of-the-funnel metrics, including response rates, pass-through rates, and candidate quality.

•Led multiple assessment centers every week (F2F and online), delivering engaging presentations to groups of up to 30 individuals and skillfully guiding them through roleplays and interviews, resulting in:

-an 85% pass-through rate
-an 87% offer acceptance rate
-a 21% “strong yes” rate from hiring managers.

•Drove the successful hiring of 36 German speakers, surpassing the target by 52%, and earning a 38% strong yes rate from hiring managers, resulting in an unprecedented recruitment outcome for this language group.

•Revitalized online sourcing strategies across various channels, including Facebook and LinkedIn groups, networking meetups, and new international free job boards, resulting in a significant +50% surge in German speaker applications and a robust talent pipeline.

•Revolutionized talent partnering strategy by leveraging candidate feedback to enhance verbal and written communication, ensuring preparedness for interviews and timely feedback delivery, resulting in a remarkable reduction in dropout rates.

•Executed multiple creative projects focused on wellbeing, engagement, and inclusion in close partnership with Talent Acquisition teams across EMEA, APAC, and NORAM regions, resulting in heightened engagement levels during the challenging times of the pandemic.
profile_positions.title: EMEA Recruiter | CS Recruiter | Finance Recruiter

profile_positions.description:
TEK Group is the global B2B leader in tire repair kit design and production, serving over 30 OEMs, such as Stellantis, Tesla, and Rolls-Royce.
As the first hired HR Generalist and Recruiter for the new Swiss HQ, I directly reported to the COO and built from scratch the HR processes, recruitment and selection strategy, and managed the comprehensive employee lifecycle.

𝗛𝗥 𝗚𝗲𝗻𝗲𝗿𝗮𝗹𝗶𝘀𝘁 𝘁𝗮𝘀𝗸𝘀
•Provided strategic HR business partnering to senior leadership, resulting in improved company performance + talent retention.

•Built strong relationships with department heads, and employees, fostering open communication and trust. 

•Developed from scratch, and implemented, HR policies and procedures in compliance with local labor laws, minimizing legal risks.

•Developed and implemented the first performance management program, resulting in improved employee performance and retention.

•Streamlined employee record management, maintaining confidentiality, accuracy, and compliance with data protection, resulting in efficient HR record-keeping and data mgmt.

•Managed effective employee relations, conflict resolution, and disciplinary actions, with a proactive approach, minimizing disruptions and maintaining positive relations.

•Conducted employee surveys, analyzed data, and implemented initiatives to increase engagement, resulting in improved organizational culture and productivity.

𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝘁𝗮𝘀𝗸𝘀
•Built and executed an effective recruitment strategy from scratch, including sourcing, job descriptions, interviews, and job offers, resulting in the timely hiring of top talent (technical and corporate).

•Fostered strong relationships with hiring managers, understanding needs and collaborating to attract quality talent, resulting in improved recruitment outcomes and high manager satisfaction.

•Designed and delivered a caring onboarding experience and provided training on our policies, resulting in increased awareness, compliance and collaboration.
profile_positions.title: HR Generalist | Recruiter

profile_positions.description:
Ignazio Messina is one of the leading Italian shipping companies in the world. 
In this role I was coordinating all administrative aspects of a new plan to build 4 RO-RO container vessels in South Korea. This involved daily liaison with the DSME Shipyard and working mainly in English, handling complex logistics and communication challenges.

•Led and executed the planning and coordination of high-profile events, such as board meetings, conferences, ship christenings in South Korea and Italy, taking the additional responsibility to act as a translator and event presenter, resulting in successful and well-organized events.

•Developed and implemented streamlined administrative processes, resulting in increased productivity and reduced operational inefficiencies for the Technical Director and a team of over 25 international engineers located in Italy and South Korea.

•Created and maintained comprehensive organizational systems for the management of a significant volume of paper and electronic documents, expense tracking, and correspondence, resulting in improved efficiency and accessibility of information.

•Implemented efficient scheduling and calendar management systems, resulting in improved time management for the Technical Director and seamless coordination of dozens of global meetings and last-minute appointments.

•Coordinated and executed complex travel arrangements, including recurring international trips, resulting in smooth and seamless travel experiences and minimized travel-related disruptions.

•Managed confidential information with the highest level of professionalism and discretion, maintaining strict confidentiality protocols and ensuring data security.

•Received recognition for exceptional performance and outstanding contributions to the success of the projects and the overall organization, by being awarded a golden plaque of appreciation from our partner Daewoo Shipbuilding and Marine Engineering based in Okpo, South Korea.
profile_positions.title: Executive Assistant | Project Management Assistant

volunteer_experiences.description: I founded a blog where I shared with jobseekers tips and best practices to improve their CV, LinkedIn profiles, interviewing skills, based on my experience as a Recruiter. I also reviewed free of charge dozens of CVs and profiles of friends and international professionals met on LinkedIn.

In April 2023, I embarked on an enriching journey by participating in the "Supportive volunteering" course offered by the Vrijwilligersacademie in Amsterdam, for which I obtained a certificate. With a focus on key topics such as the theory of supportive contact, motivation, role, and position as a volunteer, setting and guarding boundaries, giving and receiving feedback, and motivational conversation techniques, this course has equipped me with valuable skills and knowledge to make a positive impact in my volunteering efforts.

-Preparing and serving meals for the homeless
-Crafting postcards for the elderly
Cleaning up the canals with my awesome Atlassian colleagues!
